s.text: This spot, Hotel Ballroom , produced for Levi Strauss by Foote, Cone & Belding, suggests to Gen-Xers that your pants can have the same attitude as you--still young (they're Levi's, but not jeans), and a good fit; comfortable in your own identity, yet at ease in the establishment world.
Almost Zelig-like in the succeeding scenes, he continues to fit in without getting permanently trapped.
Almost Zelig-like in the succeeding scenes, he continues to fit in without getting permanently trapped.
There's a sense of something older in this space, but not of the past.

Hands on hips, he pauses, then strides toward another of those situations in which maturing Gen-Xers will inevitably find themselves, as we hear the only other bit of narration in the spot: "These are those pants ...

Hands on hips, he pauses, then strides toward another of those situations in which maturing Gen-Xers will inevitably find themselves, as we hear the only other bit of narration in the spot: "These are those pants ...
The hotel clerk's hand hits the bell, summoning a bellhop to take our hero to his room--or is it a suite?
Did he ever find the phone--and where's his cellular?
Maybe color is reserved for nights and weekends.
